# docker_logs (Data Source)

Reads logs from a Docker container.



<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `name` (String) The name or ID of the container to read logs from.

### Optional

- `discard_headers` (Boolean) Discard the first 8 bytes (Docker log header) from each log line. Default: true.
- `follow` (Boolean) Follow log output. Default: false. Note: This is only useful in streaming contexts.
- `show_stderr` (Boolean) Show stderr logs. Default: true.
- `show_stdout` (Boolean) Show stdout logs. Default: true.
- `since` (String) Show logs since timestamp (e.g., '2021-01-01T00:00:00Z') or relative time (e.g., '10m').
- `tail` (String) Number of lines to show from the end of logs. Use 'all' for all lines. Default: 'all'.
- `timestamps` (Boolean) Show timestamps in log output. Default: false.
- `until` (String) Show logs until timestamp (e.g., '2021-01-01T00:00:00Z') or relative time (e.g., '10m').

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) The ID of this data source.
- `logs_raw` (String) The raw log output from the container.
